More Musics will update weekly...!

Features of Nature Sounds : Peaceful, Sleep, Relax, Anti Stress provides to our kind users:

- Nature Soundscapes :Relax & Sleep to White Noise Ambient Sounds.
- Beautiful interface with high quality images.
- Beautiful Relaxing  Natural wallpapers.
- Timer option, so you can drift off to sleep without the sounds playing all night long.
- Perfectly looped Peaceful Sounds.
- Calm down your little kids also with the relax sounds. .
- Study Music: You can Use as Study relax music app.
- You can regain control over insomnia, night time, anxiety and tinnitus.
- Play single sound at a time or make a combo with sounds and music.
- Free Meditation Music is a free meditation app to relax the body and mind.
- Aim of our meditation app is to bring mental, physical and spiritual health. 
- 20+ soothing nature sounds and scenes to use during meditation, yoga or to help you sleep also.

Relax wallpapers with sounds and music can wipe away the day's stress, bringing with it inner peace completely. If you are anxious, tense or worried, consider trying these nature sounds or music. Spending even few minutes in meditation can restore your health and inner peace.

Positive Effects on our body of Nature Sounds:

-  Relaxing music helps to fall fast asleep and sleep better at night without any stress.
-  Peaceful sounds helps to clear your mind and concentrate on meditating or focus on study. 
-  Natural sounds helps to encourage creativity.
-  Sleep sounds  can help parents lull a newborn baby to sleep well at night.

title: Mindfulness: Guided Meditation for Stress, Anxiety
description:
This app contains the best guided mindfulness meditation audio curated for maximum relaxation, fight stress, anxiety, panic attack, procrastination and gives you clarity and peace of mind. This can be used for everyone from beginners to those who practice mindfulness regularly.

Mindfulness Guide app includes:

- 5 minutes Breathing meditation for beginners
-12 minutes intermediate breath, sound and body scan meditation
- 19 minutes Complete Meditation for advanced users
- 9 minutes and 20 minutes versions of Loving and Kindness Meditation
- 7 Minutes meditation for working with difficulties
-3 minutes short body scan and body and sound meditation guide
- 27 minutes guided sitting practice meditation
- 13 minutes body scan for sleep for sleep-deprived users


This Mindfulness Guide app sessions are all free to use. No monthly subscription. No in-app purchasing. No none sense and minimalist design.

Additional bonus sessions are music background for sleep.
And there's more! 3 high quality spa music for relaxation and reflection.



Sample Transcript is written below:

Breathing Meditation (5:31)

Find a relaxed, comfortable position
Seated on a chair or on the floor, on a cushion
Keep your back upright, but not too tight
Hands resting wherever they're comfortable
Tongue on the roof of your mouth or wherever it's comfortable.
And you can notice your body
From the inside
Noticing the shape of your body, the weight, touch
And let yourself relax
And become curious about your body
Seated here
The sensations of your body
The touch
The connection with the floor
The chair
Relax any areas of tightness or tension
Just breathe
Soften
And now begin to tune into your breath
In your body
Feeling the natural flow of breath
Don't need to do anything to your breath
Not long not short just natural
And notice where you feel your breath in your body
It might be in your abdomen
It may be in your chest or throat
Or in your nostrils
See if you can feel the sensations of breath
One breath at a time
When one breath ends, the next breath begins
Now as you do this you might notice that your mind might start to wander
You might start thinking about other things
If this happens this is not a problem
It's very natural
Just notice that your mind has wandered
You can say "thinking" or "wandering" in your head softly
And then gently redirect your attention right back to the breathing
So we'll stay with this for some time in silence
Just a short time
Noticing our breath
From time to time getting lost in thought and returning to our breath
See if you can be really kind to yourself in the process
And once again you can notice your body, your whole body, seated here
Let yourself relax even more deeply
And then offer yourself some appreciation
For doing this practice today
Whatever that means to you
Finding a sense of ease and well being for yourself and this day
[bell rings]

comments: App went down April 8-9, 2019. since it's been back online, it glitches. It stops, somewhere in the middle of the meditation, then in the early morning, it will finish by waking me up, with the finish of the meditation. It's not a four star anymore. Too bad. I used to love this app, it was my favorite. * I reinstalled, it didn't help.

Fastest way to meditate, just open app and select the version or time limit that suits you. Not as varied as Insight Timer, but If you need to relax NOW, and don't want to click on several pages before you get to the actual meditations, then this is the app for you. Instant meditations, no BS no loud or flashing ads, you are always seconds away from guided relaxation & grounding techniques. Simple, reliable and drama free access to guided meditations

lovely music to induce deep relaxation, even when you think you might be too stressed to unwind. with tracks at 8 hours long, the music won't suddenly stop and jolt you out of your chilled groove. the woman who talks thru the meditations has a soothing voice, I was worried it might grate after a while, but I find it quite the opposite. I could do without the gong before and after meditations as I found it quite jarring, but that's my only gripe with otherwise decent spp

I find this app very relaxing. The lady narrator has a warm and relaxing voice to listen to which makes meditation comfortable. Although the music meditations are nice, personally I prefer the guided meditations to chill and to go to sleep. I hope there will be another update soon will include more guided meditations.
glitches and stops in the middle of meditation. No cool! when my phone goes to sleep so does the meditation, it does not continue as it should. Very annoying.

title: Mandala Stress Reliever
description:
Mandala Stress Reliever is coloring book for adults with delightful mandala to help you free your mind from all negative thoughts and become more kind and relax.
We have made thoroughly composed compilation of Mandalas from whole world.



 Feeling stressed out? Want to experience peace and tranquility?
 Mandala Coloring for Adults has a large number of mandala coloring pages with beautiful, intricately detailed mandalas for you to color.
 Mandalas are circular figures symbolizing the universe in Buddhism and Hinduism.
 Colouring these sacred circles helps you manage anxiety, relieve stress, and calm your mind.
 We have made thoroughly composed compilation of Mandalas from whole world.

Mandala Stress Reliever Features:

 1. This mandala coloring book has mesmerizing mandalas.
 Some of the are easy and lightly detailed, others are relatively more detailed, and the rest mandalas are highly detailed. 
 So, Depending on your free time, you can choose the most suitable
 2. You can zoom and scroll the pictures easily using your fingers. 
 3. If needed, you can undo the previous coloring actions with the 'Undo' feature. 
 4. The colour palette has loads of colors, with several shades of each color. 
 5. Once you colour any mandala, your work is automatically saved in the app. And, for sure, you never lose your art. 
 6. In the end, you can download any image in your device's Gallery. 



How To Use:

1) Open application Mandala Stress Reliever
2) Pick you favourite Mandalas
3) Start colouring with pleasure and tranquility
4) Print or share with friends


 Nowadays, almost everyone suffers from stress and anxiety. Mandala Stress Reliever is coloring book for adults with delightful mandala to help you free your mind from all negative thoughts and become more kind and relax. Colouring the peaceful mandalas heals you mentally and emotionally.


Enjoy our amazing Mandala Stress Reliever and recommend to your buddies and fiance, please.

title: Get Out of Stress
description:
Get Out of Stress

Modern life is full of deadlines, frustrations, and demands. For many people, stress is so commonplace that it has become a way of life.
You can protect yourself by recognizing the signs and symptoms of stress and taking steps to reduce its harmful effects.
This Application gives you complete idea about Stress , its symptoms and stress management in simple and efficient way. 

The Application Includes

** What is stress
** Symptoms of short term stress
** Symptoms of longterm stress
** Ways to avoid stress
** Ways to overcome Stress
** Yoga for Stress

Use this App and Kick off all your stress and enjoy LIFE...!!!

recentChanges:

comments: The game looks beautiful with its pencil art style. The drawing in each level is nice and the pop sound when you press anything is somewhat soothing. But if you're expecting a "challenging puzzle" from this game, you'd be disappointed, like me. This is a memory game, asking "how well can you remember the image you just saw".
I would give it 5 stars but there are a lot of bugs with the game. Some of the interactions you are supposed to have with some levels are unavailable to perform or do not exist.
Good Game üëç. My only suggestion is when a player answers wrong option the next time when that particular answer appears just shuffle the options.

Fantastic game. Beautifully done, but not for me. It gave me a more anxiety instead of being relaxing because I couldn't retain information from the previous slide. I played a ton of levels and will keep the app to try at a later time. Maybe I'm just having an off night. Great job, dev!

Need refund this game is a scam. Only 14 reviews? all by dev's. Do Not Fall for it. there's a reason why no free trial. there are no directions. you show a drop of what looks like water and we have to figure out what it is. the number of birds for example. where is there a third one? or are we supposed to automatically add +1 at random. the game needs clear directions. you show birds all animated in answer but bird in picture is static, not moving. lot of inconistancies. GL

title: Stress Relief Yoga
description:
Stress Relief Yoga

Maintaining a yoga practice can be a great way to reduce stress, anxiety and tension, stay in shape and calm the mind. But when it comes to stress relief, not all yoga poses are created equal: Some positions are particularly effective for promoting relaxation, tension relief and restfulness.

This ten minutes yoga practice is perfect for a tired body and a busy mind. Try this sequence to calm the nervous system and do a little energetic hygiene as you relive anxiety and stress from the body.  This yoga class that is geared towards all levels and can be done in the morning to clear and prepare your mind for the day to come, in the evening after a stressful day, or anytime you're feeling overwhelmed and need to reset.

Connect to your breath and take some time for YOU. Let go of that which is no longer serving you! Open your mind, your heart and stretch and soothe your body. Enjoy!

This yoga class that is geared towards all levels and can be done in the morning to clear and prepare your mind for the day to come, in the evening after a stressful day, or anytime you're feeling overwhelmed and need to reset.

Connect to your breath and take some time for YOU. Let go of that which is no longer serving you! Open your mind, your heart and stretch and soothe your body. Enjoy!
summary: Ten minute yoga sequence; perfect for a tired body and a busy mind.

title: Managing your stress & anxiety
description:
This app provides information and evidence-based coping strategies to help you manage stress and anxiety during the COVID-19 pandemic. It is not intended to be a resource for people who require screening for COVID-19 or are experiencing a mental health crisis. If you are experiencing a mental health crisis, please contact 911 immediately or present to your nearest emergency department.

The Centre for Addiction and Mental Health (CAMH) is Canada's largest mental health teaching hospital and one of the world's leading research centres in its field. CAMH is fully affiliated with the University of Toronto and is a Pan American Health Organization/World Health Organization Collaborating Centre.

title: Stress Test - Premium
description:
Stress is our body's response to an event or pressure situation.
There are several internal and external factors that influence this response.
Knowing how to manage stress is a topic that has gained increasing prominence.
This APP, through a questionnaire, helps you to identify factors and triggers that make you a more or less stressed person
For the test to be valid, you must answer all questions honestly.
Take the test regularly to see if your stress level is improving or getting worse.

title: Stress Relief
description:
Stress is a fact of life. Although some stress is normal and even needed, too much of it can affect your quality of life and your health.

When you feel stressed, you can:

- Take slow, deep breaths.
- Soak in a warm bath.
- Listen to soothing music.
- Take a walk or do some other activity.
- Meditate or pray.
- Take a yoga class.
- Have a massage or back rub.
- Have a warm drink that doesn't have alcohol or caffeine.

You also can make some changes in your everyday habits to reduce and relieve stress.

- Get plenty of sleep.
- Stay connected to your family, friends, and other caring people in your life.
- Get regular exercise. It can help you clear your mind and work off feelings of frustration and anxiety.
- Don't drink or eat anything that has caffeine in it. Caffeine can make you feel "wound up" and more stressed.
- Don't smoke or use tobacco. Nicotine can make you feel more anxious.
- Don't drink alcohol. It can cause sleep problems and depression.

Relaxation can help to relieve the symptoms of stress. It can help you calm down and take a step back from a stressful situation.

Although the cause of the anxiety won't disappear, you will probably feel more able to deal with it once you've released the tension in your body and cleared your thoughts.

Many relaxation techniques combine breathing more deeply with relaxing the muscles.

Don't worry if you find it difficult to relax at first. It's a skill that needs to be learned and it will come with practice.

Practise deep breathing at a regular time and in a quiet place where you won't be disturbed. Loosen or remove any tight clothes you have on, such as shoes or jackets. Make yourself feel completely comfortable.

Sit in a comfy chair which supports your head or lie on the floor or bed. Place your arms on the chair arms, or flat on the floor or bed, a little bit away from the side of your body with the palms up. If you're lying down, stretch out your legs, keeping them hip-width apart or slightly wider. If you're sitting in a chair, don't cross your legs.

Relaxation techniques usually start with focusing on your breathing. The way to do it is to breathe in and out slowly and in a regular rhythm as this will help you to calm down.

Download this app and learn more on how to reduce stress.
descriptionHTML:
Stress is a fact of life. Although some stress is normal and even needed, too much of it can affect your quality of life and your health.

When you feel stressed, you can:

- Take slow, deep breaths.
- Soak in a warm bath.
- Listen to soothing music.
- Take a walk or do some other activity.
- Meditate or pray.
- Take a yoga class.
- Have a massage or back rub.
- Have a warm drink that doesn't have alcohol or caffeine.

You also can make some changes in your everyday habits to reduce and relieve stress.

- Get plenty of sleep.
- Stay connected to your family, friends, and other caring people in your life.
- Get regular exercise. It can help you clear your mind and work off feelings of frustration and anxiety.
- Don't drink or eat anything that has caffeine in it. Caffeine can make you feel "wound up" and more stressed.
- Don't smoke or use tobacco. Nicotine can make you feel more anxious.
- Don't drink alcohol. It can cause sleep problems and depression.

Relaxation can help to relieve the symptoms of stress. It can help you calm down and take a step back from a stressful situation.

Although the cause of the anxiety won't disappear, you will probably feel more able to deal with it once you've released the tension in your body and cleared your thoughts.

Many relaxation techniques combine breathing more deeply with relaxing the muscles.

Don't worry if you find it difficult to relax at first. It's a skill that needs to be learned and it will come with practice.

Practise deep breathing at a regular time and in a quiet place where you won't be disturbed. Loosen or remove any tight clothes you have on, such as shoes or jackets. Make yourself feel completely comfortable.

Sit in a comfy chair which supports your head or lie on the floor or bed. Place your arms on the chair arms, or flat on the floor or bed, a little bit away from the side of your body with the palms up. If you're lying down, stretch out your legs, keeping them hip-width apart or slightly wider. If you're sitting in a chair, don't cross your legs.

Relaxation techniques usually start with focusing on your breathing. The way to do it is to breathe in and out slowly and in a regular rhythm as this will help you to calm down.

Download this app and learn more on how to reduce stress.
summary: These stress management and relaxation techniques will help you chill

title: idstress - Overcome stress
description:
Train your mind, Mind yourself. A strong mind is the best defense against stress. With the help of idstress you can overcome stress and alleviated it‚Äôs symptoms starting with only 5 steps for free. Train your mind and improve your wellbeing everyday with a personalized program made according to your needs and your results from the stress test. The personalized program consist of an extended and varied list of meditations and breathings arranged by series that will give you the opportunity of trying a new exercise in a daily routine. Just like going to the mind gym everyday.


THE FIRST 5 STEPS 

Step 1: Improve your concentration. With the first step, in less than 2 minutes, you will be able to free your mind, calm your thoughts and focus your attention in the present moment.

Steps 2: Sleep to wake up rested. Within 2 minutes with your own breathing you will be able to relax every part of your body and clear your mind to sleep and rest as your body and mind deserve.

Step 3: Relax your head and shoulders. There are key points in our body that stress attacks with tension. In this third step you will be able to relax two of the most important parts of your body so you can also clear your mind and feel at your best to go through your day.

Step 4: Have a good posture. Be aware of your body and your breathing by taking this 2 minutes step that will help you to feel comfortable in a good posture without stress.

Step 5: Breath. Find a moment of fullness where you meet with your emotions to liberate every part of your body from tensions and worries. Let your mind and body be in a total harmony within this 2 minutes step. 


BENEFITS OF TRAINING YOUR MIND

Reduce stress, anxiety and worries.
Enjoy better relationships with your loved ones.
Sleep, eat, love and think better.
Experience peace of mind and mind-body connection 
Improve focus and performance at work.
Increase self-awareness.
Healthy emotional management. 
Prevent diseases.


ANA LOMBARD  

idstress app is based in the methods and knowledge about meditation active and reflective adapted to the needs of modern life and the power of breathing, from the therapist Ana Lombard.

Her mission as a therapist is to help people to unite and perceive mind, body, abilities and values, in order to achieve a global balance in their life.


FEATURES

5 steps to alleviate stress symptoms and overcome stress.
Personalized program based on your results from the Stress Test.
Series of meditation and breathing exercises to help you reduce stress level in specific situations.
Stress test that allows you to identified your level of stress and have a Personalized Program according to your needs or the serie you have chosen.
Express Relaxations with short written exercises for you to take a few minutes and deal with stress in specific moments.

title: Stress Relief
description: Stress. We all deal with it. Whether it arises from our jobs, family life, drama with friends, a relationship problem, or finances, stress is there. While a little stress is good for you, allowing you to grow physically and mentally, excessive and chronic stress is harmful. Prolonged stress can even lead to tension headaches and other health problems that limit your functioning at work, at school and in your relationships.[1] Rather than letting your stress take over your life, try some methods of stress-management that you can apply to prevent and deal with stress before it jeopardizes your health.

title: anxiety and stress routines
description:
Stress is a feeling of physical or emotional tension. It can come from any situation or thought that makes one feel frustrated, furious or nervous.

The cause of stress is the presence of a stressor, anxiety is the stress that continues after the stressor has already disappeared.

symptoms of too much stress:
- symptoms of diarrhea or constipation
- symptoms of bad memory
- symptoms of frequent aches and pains
- headache symptoms
- symptoms of lack of energy or concentration
- symptoms of sexual problems
- Rigid neck or jaw
- Tiredness
- Trouble sleeping or sleeping too much
- Stomach upset
- Use of alcohol or drugs to relax
- Weight loss or gain

Feeling anxiety occasionally is a normal part of life. However, people with anxiety disorders often have intense, excessive and persistent worries and fears about daily situations. Perform relaxation and breathing exercises promotes health.

These feelings of anxiety and panic interfere with daily activities, are difficult to control, are disproportionate compared to real danger and can last a long time.

We teach you many mental relaxation techniques and relaxation exercises so you can have peace of mind to control anxiety and stress.

Relaxation is very important in our life, having a daily tranquility favors our health, breathing exercises to control anxiety and stress.

It is good to have physical exercise routines, good eating routines, relaxation exercise routines, breathing control exercise routines, all these routines favor our physical and mental health.

Download this free application to improve your health, control your breath and the symptoms of stress and anxiety. Put in your life some healthy routines to improve your physical and mental health.

title: Stress Management
description:
Everybody goes through different levels of stress throughout their lives. The stress of writing a final exam to raising a child to financial challenges. That being said more and more is expected of us now because of cultural and environmental changes.

That is why stress management and learning how to reduce your stress is so important in today's society. It is even more important to find ways to reduce, prevent and cope with stress throughout your day and life.

There are many health issues associated with high stress levels such as: depression, digestive problems, weight problems, and thinking and memory problems to name a few.

We need to be aware of the external and internal causes of stress and not allow them to take over our daily lives.

We urge you to start learning effective ways of managing your stress and start by downloading our free app today.
descriptionHTML:
Everybody goes through different levels of stress throughout their lives. The stress of writing a final exam to raising a child to financial challenges. That being said more and more is expected of us now because of cultural and environmental changes.

That is why stress management and learning how to reduce your stress is so important in today's society. It is even more important to find ways to reduce, prevent and cope with stress throughout your day and life.

There are many health issues associated with high stress levels such as: depression, digestive problems, weight problems, and thinking and memory problems to name a few.

We need to be aware of the external and internal causes of stress and not allow them to take over our daily lives.

We urge you to start learning effective ways of managing your stress and start by downloading our free app today.
summary: Control the daily Stress

title: Coping With Stress
description:
Stress Management: How to Reduce, Prevent, and coping with stress

Look at how you currently coping with stress

Think about the ways you currently manage and coping with stress in your life. Your stress journal can help you identify them. Are your coping strategies healthy or unhealthy, helpful or unproductive? Unfortunately, many people coping with stress in ways that compound the problem.

If your methods of coping with stress aren‚Äôt contributing to your greater emotional and physical health, it‚Äôs time to find healthier ones. There are many healthy ways to manage and cope with stress, but they all require change. You can either change the situation or change your reaction. When deciding which option to choose, it‚Äôs helpful to think of the four As: avoid, alter, adapt, or accept.

Some sources of stress are unavoidable. You can‚Äôt prevent or change stressors such as the death of a loved one, a serious illness, or a national recession. In such cases, the best way to cope with stress is to accept things as they are. Acceptance may be difficult, but in the long run, it‚Äôs easier than railing against a situation you can‚Äôt change.

Eat a healthy diet. Well-nourished bodies are better prepared to cope with stress, so be mindful of what you eat. Start your day right with breakfast, and keep your energy up and your mind clear with balanced, nutritious meals throughout the day.

title: Stress Relief
description: Stress is often described as a feeling of being overloaded, woundup tight, tense and worried. We all experience stress at times. It can sometimes help to motivate us to get a task finished, or perform well. But stress can also be harmful if we become over-stressed and it interferes with our ability to get on with our normal life for too long. Modern life is full of deadlines, frustrations, and demands. For many people, stress is so commonplace that it has become a way of life. Everyday life causes stress! Things like waiting in line, traffic jams, work stress, being in debt, and even poor health all cause stress. You can protect yourself by recognizing the signs and symptoms of stress and taking steps to reduce its harmful effects. This Application gives you complete idea about Stress , its symptoms and stress management in simple and efficient way in your android mobile.

title: Pull the Pin
description:
In this game full of satisfying graphics and innovative levels, you can challenge yourself, your brain, and your friends! It‚Äôs you against physics and the tricky levels ‚Äî WHO WILL WIN?

All balls have to go into the pipe ‚Ä¶ can you remove the pins in the right order and make it happen?

It should be simple: gravity pulls the balls down towards the pipe. But then pins are in the way! Can you help out and flip away the pins and get the balls to where they are supposed to be?

But wait: there is another level of trickery! Sometimes some of the balls are colorless: before they go into the pipe, they need to touch a color ball, so the color spreads to them as well. So simple yet so tricky!
descriptionHTML:
In this game full of satisfying graphics and innovative levels, you can challenge yourself, your brain, and your friends! It‚Äôs you against physics and the tricky levels ‚Äî WHO WILL WIN?

All balls have to go into the pipe ‚Ä¶ can you remove the pins in the right order and make it happen?

It should be simple: gravity pulls the balls down towards the pipe. But then pins are in the way! Can you help out and flip away the pins and get the balls to where they are supposed to be?

But wait: there is another level of trickery! Sometimes some of the balls are colorless: before they go into the pipe, they need to touch a color ball, so the color spreads to them as well. So simple yet so tricky!
summary: Can you reach the pinnacle?
recentChanges: Bug fixes + performance improvements. Thank you for playing!
comments: The first problem is the puzzles are far too simplistic to be entertaining. Finishing them does not provide any kind of sense of accomplishment. The biggest problem is that this is another app that exists as an engine to vomit ads at you that stop any media currently playing. Listening to a podcast? Not when one of these ads starts. And there are so many of them. Fail the puzzle? Here's an ad. Did you win? Congratulations here's an ad. In 10 minutes if game I spent over 5 of it watching ads.

Very easy, mindless game. Very little skill required. Has a lot of noisy adds, many with no volume off button, so don't play at work for a mindless break. Many adverts crash the game, resulting in having to replay the last round. I've lost interest now. Levels never get hard, & repeat earlier rounds. Boring.

A Little bit inane. Not much difficulty @ higher levels. It took abiut 15 minutes to reach level 45. Most of the time was taken up by adverts for other games. Realising it is your bread and butter to have a multitude of games available, and being played, with adverts inserted from time to time, but not at every level change whilst progressing through the game. I suggest (example) don't attempt or try to get people to role play, when they are playing logic or puzzle games.

This game has a lot of potential, unfortunately that potential is negated by the total overuse of advertisements, a level taking 5 seconds is then followed by up to 40 seconds of advertisements... deleted, Yes I understand the manufacturers of the game have to make a living and advertisements is their way of doing so, but taking the fun out of the game is not the way forwardüò•

Do you like puzzles that are very, very, very simple? Do you like spending lots of your time watching ads? If so, this might be the app for you. I actually find that I do play it from time to time. Sometimes I'm just in the mood for mindless winning with no effort. The game eagerly congratulates you after every simple win. I'm on level 353 now, so obviously I've spent some time playing it. It doesn't get any harder. A couple of the last few levels I played were literally un-losable.

title: Stress Reduction Audio
description:
Want to better learn how to relax and find some stress relief?  Stress Reduction-Audio contains two guided relaxation techniques to guide you through the process of becoming more fully relaxed. Some people find these techniques helpful for getting to sleep at night. Additionally, the app includes a number of peaceful nature sounds that may be used to help fall asleep.

This free version of the app includes ads and streams the audio from the Internet (so data rates may apply from your carrier if not using Wifi).  The Full version allows you to download the full audio files to your device rather than streaming them from a remote server, and does not contain ads.

Two relaxation techniques are included along with a peaceful and relaxing background music.

1. Relax and Breathe - Walks you through relaxing all the muscles in your body combined with a deep breathing exercise. (7 minutes and 40 seconds)

2. Relax and Visualize - This technique is a mildly self-hypnotic procedure that includes relaxing your muscles, mind, and visualizing a peaceful scene.  This is often a favorite. (15 minutes)

Note: These techniques are not intended to treat any emotional or physical condition.  Rather, this app is intended for people who want to learn one of many techniques for coping with the stress of everyday living.  If recommended by a psychotherapist, it may be used as a part of a larger treatment program.

title: Stress Is Gone
description:
This complete mobile stress management system is certified by The American Institute of Stress and reduces job stress, financial stress, family stress, emotional stress, and mental stress. The app predicts your stress, teaches you how to meditate, stops stress with one-touch instant relief, and helps resolve the deeper emotional traumas that intensify everyday stress. Through brainwave entrainment, the app teaches you how to quickly shut down the body‚Äôs fight-or-flight reaction by activating the relaxation response. The app can also connect you with a live coach as needed.

KEY FEATURES:
‚àö One-Touch Instant Relief - The Stopper Tab helps you manage random reactions by offering fast relief at your finger tips.
‚àö Reminders 3-Minutes Before Your Stress Starts - The Stopper Tab also helps you predict & circumvent routine reactions before the stress is triggered.
‚àö Meditation Practice Management - The MyMeds Tab helps you structure and maintain your daily meditation practice.
‚àö Revolutionary Tool to Resolve Traumatic Memories - The Resolve Tab helps you surface and soothe those past memories that intensify present day stress reactions.
‚àö Teaches Stress Stopper Breathwork ‚Äì By following the audio / video animation, this 3-step process helps you learn how to take control by activating the relaxation response whenever you become stressed.
‚àö Connect with a Coach ‚Äì Enables you to contact a coach if/when your stress becomes unmanageable.

STANDARD FEATURES:
‚àö Intuitive set-up and design
‚àö Facebook Integration
‚àö In App Browser

APP BENEFITS:
‚àö Naturally avoid stress related diseases
‚àö Naturally calm stressful emotions
‚àö Naturally quiet stressful thoughts
‚àö Naturally stop a stress reaction
‚àö Enjoy all the benefits of meditation
‚àö Learn to fall asleep fast

The key to living stress free is using this app daily. Every time you become stressed, press the app icon and breathe. Every time a Stress Stopper reminder shows up on your phone, breathe along with the animation. When it‚Äôs time to meditate, give yourself the 20-minutes of relaxation that will improve your life. And finally, get to the root of the issue. Use the Resolve Tab to heal any stressful memories from your past that may be affecting the quality of your present day life. Using all these tools together will prolong your life and help prevent future stress-related health issues such as cancer, panic attacks, anxiety, depression, cardiovascular and gastrointestinal diseases, migraines, sleep disorders, chronic fatigue, ulcers, etc.

Meditators showed hospitalization rates 87% less than non-meditators for heart disease, 55% less for tumors, 50% less for out-patient doctor visits, and 30% less for infectious diseases. - Orme-Johnson, Psychosomatic Medicine 49 (1987)

title: How to Relieve Stress
description:
Small amounts of stress are healthy and can help you get stuff done. But high levels of stress can have a serious impact on your mental and physical health so it‚Äôs important that you find ways to manage this.

People find different things relaxing so we‚Äôve constructed a list of our fave chilling out tips and urge you to give them a try to see which ones work for you!

1. Watch something funny. Laughter really is the best medicine. It relieves physical tension, reduces stress and increases immunity‚Ä¶so watch your fave comedy and laugh your way to tranquility.

2. Body Clench. This relaxation exercise may make you look a bit constipated but give it a go! Starting with your toes, go up through your body, gradually clenching each of your muscles right through to the tiny ones in your face, keep your whole body clenched, hold and then release to let go of all the tension. Feels good, right?

3. Try the Naam Yoga Hand Trick. Using your fingertips, apply pressure to the space between the knuckles of your index and middle fingers. This creates a sense of immediate relaxation by activating a nerve that loosens the area around your heart (don‚Äôt worry, it‚Äôs not as life-threatening as it sounds).

4. Stop multitasking. No wonder we‚Äôre all mega-stressed when we‚Äôre replying to text messages, whilst watching TV and speaking on the phone simultaneously! Not only is multitasking totally inefficient, but it‚Äôs also linked to the increased production of stress hormones (cortisol and adrenaline) that can send your body into panic mode! So chill out and take things one step at a time.

5. Get a Colouring Book. They‚Äôve exploded in popularity over recent months and for good reason ‚Äì colouring in helps you chill out because it‚Äôs very difficult to focus on other things when you‚Äôre doing it.
6. Meditate. Create a little zen den in your room where you can meditate (e.g. light candles and incense, play calming music). Reaching a meditative state takes practice but there are some great tips for beginners online. Meditation can help ease anxiety and improve concentration, so peace out.

7. Squeeze a stress ball. Using a stress ball can help alleviate tension by promoting muscle relaxation and providing a general sense of release.

8. Keeping a diary. Venting all those thoughts and emotions onto paper can make your feelings and problems seem less intimidating. Writing can be both insightful and therapeutic so get those words down on paper!

title: Stress First Aid
description:
The Stress First Aid app is a community resource that provides guidance and resources for individuals dealing with stress, and for leaders, family members, friends, and co-workers who know someone who is currently dealing with emotional stress or is in a crisis situation. The hyperlinks contained in this App are not an endorsement of such websites or the information contained therein.

The Stress First Aid app includes these features:

* Suicide Intervention:  ACE
* Crisis Referral Path
* Stress Continuum
* Stress First Aid Model
* Stress Indicators
* Actions to Help
* More Resources.

title: Resility Stress Management & Biofeedback
description:
So many of us are living with chronic, nonstop stress in our lives. This affects sleep, mood, health, and relationships. Stress causes or aggravates issues like insomnia, anxiety, depression, and even headaches and chronic pain.

Welcome to a better way to manage stress. 

Resility helps you become more aware of how stress feels in your body, and gives you a much needed break from the stress cycle in order to rest and recover. Giving your body these breaks can improve mood, sleep, focus, productivity, and creativity.

Our easy, 5-10 minute training sessions include a variety of relaxation and breathing exercises, mindfulness, and positive psychology. Try different things to see what works best for you. When you pair our app with our wearable bluetooth Muscle Activity Sensor (sold separately at ResilityHealth.com/sensor), you will get real-time biofeedback to actually see how your body is responding. This teaches you to recognize the early signs of stress, and head it off before it escalates. 

Our users are amazed at what a difference our short, 5 to 10 minute exercises can make.

The Resility app has three modes:

RELAXATION TRAINING
Short guided audio exercises walk you through a variety of relaxation techniques. These can be used alone, or with our wearable Muscle Activity Sensor (sold separately). Pairing with the Sensor lets you see how your muscle tension changes in response to an exercise.

Relaxation training incorporates:
-breathing exercises
-muscle relaxation
-mindfulness
-visualization
-positive psychology
-biofeedback (with Muscle Activity Sensor)

MONITOR MUSCLE ACTIVITY
Get feedback on how your muscle activity changes in real time. This mode can only be used with our Muscle Activity Sensor, which uses electromyography, or EMG biofeedback, to measure the activity in a muscle. In Monitor mode you can set a threshold to get alerted when your muscle tension exceeds it. The alert can be an audible alarm or set to vibrate. Sessions can be recorded.

Muscle tension in the shoulders is so common when you‚Äôre stressed, and it‚Äôs a popular place to use our Sensor. The alert cues you when your tension exceeds the threshold, and the biofeedback teaches to release that tension at will. You can do this when working at the computer or during tasks where your muscles inadvertently tense up. 

VIEW PROGRESS
View the history of training and recorded monitoring sessions. See the date, length, and amount of muscle activity reduction together with a graph of how your muscle activity changed. You must purchase the Muscle Activity Sensor to view muscle activity data.

NOTE: the Muscle Activity Sensor is sold separately at http://resilityhealth.com/sensor

App features:
- variety of guided relaxation training exercises
- real time biofeedback of muscle activity (Sensor required)
- audio or vibrate alert notifies you when muscle activity exceeds designated threshold (Sensor required)
- track history and progress (muscle activity tracking requires Sensor)

Muscle Activity Sensor features (available at ResilityHealth.com/sensor):
- wireless wearable Bluetooth sensor pairs with app
- disposable adhesive strips to use with muscles such as shoulders, back, and jaw
- rechargeable battery
- 8 hour battery life per charge

Benefits of EMG biofeedback and relaxation training:
-reduce insomnia, anxiety, back pain, neck pain, and TMJ
-improve sleep, performance, productivity, and focus
-increase awareness of stress related tension in your body
-learn to reduce muscle tension before it escalates

To learn more, visit http://resilityhealth.com

Resility Health products are for educational purposes and do not diagnose, treat or cure any medical condition. Please consult your health care provider before using this product.

title: Unburden ‚Äì Anxiety, Stress, Depression Chat App
description:
Introduction ‚Äì
Unburden is a community of people who are fighting Depression, Anxiety, Panic Attacks, Relationships issues etc. and want to talk to someone. Listeners can also sign up on unburden and help the people who are dealing with mental health issues.

You will always remain 100% anonymous on unburden and chat 1 ‚Äì to ‚Äì 1 with listeners any time. On Unburden, speak your mind without the feeling of being judged.

What it IS?
This depression chat app provides a safe and confidential space to all those who need to talk to someone about anxiety, depression, stress and loneliness, confine into someone but do not have access to professional psychologist, psychiatrist or therapists due to economic or social reasons. 
Here you can get help from all the kind hearted people around the world, or you can choose to help others get things off their chest.

We believe in community service, and unburden is just a medium of bringing sharers and listeners together. 

What this app is NOT
Unburden is not a replacement for professional Mental Health Experts, psychologist, psychiatrist or therapists. If you have requirement & have access to professional services then it is highly recommended that you visit them, Mental Health is Important!

Why we NEED it?
We Believe that everyone who needs help should get it. And all of us together can make this happen. We can atleast virtually be there for each other when we are feeling down (or jolly). Users are the core of unburden app. Users willing to help each other are what make this app what it is.
- Keeping things BOTTTLED UP is a very unhealthy practice
- Talking to people about what‚Äôs been stressing and worrying you will help you
- Comfort of having someone to share thoughts with is of healing nature

Who Needs it?
WHO NEEDS UNBURDEN ‚Äì ANTI DEPRESSION APP?
1. People who require support to deal with 
- Depression
- Anxiety
- Obsessive-Compulsive Disorder (OCD)
- Panic attacks
- Post Traumatic Stress Disorder (PTSD)
- Mood disorders
- Stress 
- LGBTQ
- Gender identity crisis
- anything which is not good for your mental health
2. People who feel lonely and are hesitant to reach out due to social stigma and economic concerns.
3. People who have saviors in them and love to help community, they can join as listeners, because all heroes don‚Äôt wear capes.
4. People who want to speak their mind without worrying of being judged.

Confidentiality and Privacy
"Confidentiality" and "Privacy" are two of the main Pillars of this app. We have taken all the necessary measures to ensure that nothing hampers your privacy (we respect your privacy) and once you complete sign-up process, only thing we will know about you is your 'username'.
Your email-id and password are encrypted in a way that even we ourselves can't decrypt it.
- We won't know your email-id so you will never receive any annoying promotional emails.
- Your chats will NEVER be stored.
- We will NEVER share your username with anyone.

 Peaceful background music and nature sounds to help you relax. Continue listening to background sounds after the session ends. title: Anxiety Cures - Relieve Stress, Increase Happiness
description:
Anxiety Cures is an educational/research app to help you end anxiety, improve mental health, manage stress, reduce depression, increase mindfulness, stop panic attacks, and finding happiness. 

The app is updated regularly with in-depth knowledge, extensive research, and tools from many sources, that are scientifically shown to help reduce stress and improve relaxation, like calming sounds generator, brain training, sleep time calculator, and breathing exercises.

How To Use This App For Maximum Results
1Ô∏è‚É£  You will receive one (or more) articles virtually every day.
2Ô∏è‚É£  Spend 1-5 minutes to read/skim the article. If the article interest you, bookmark it for easier find later.
3Ô∏è‚É£  When you have more time in the day, you can dig deeper to understand more the subject taught in the article. Use your daily journal to make some notes as necessary. You can spend 15-30 minutes on this.
4Ô∏è‚É£  If the article requires you to take actions, e.g., to do some breathing exercise, relaxation or meditation, make a plan to find the best time and space where you can perform the actions effectively. You can do it on the same day, or later in the weekend.
5Ô∏è‚É£  Make this as part of your daily/weekly ritual, and you'll see positive changes happening in your life and happiness becomes your life's reality.

In today‚Äôs fast-paced, rapidly-changing world, feeling stressed and overwhelmed has quickly become a big part of our everyday lives ‚Äì and being able to identify and cope with anxiety, stress, and depression is fast becoming an essential life skill.

Features
‚òÖ Contents to help relieve anxiety, sleep well, relaxation, happiness (updated regularly)
‚òÖ Motivational videos
‚òÖ Inspirational quotes
‚òÖ Tools for relaxation, breathing exercise, sleep sounds: rain sound, calming sound, white noise, sleep calculator, brain test, etc.
‚òÖ Free and fun games to help improve your mood, train your mental agility and kill some time.

Download now. Turn your stress to your advantage and your fear into confidence

title: Be Mentally Healthy (Stress and Anxiety Therapy)
description:
Are you struggling with depression or anxiety? 
Do you often feel low and ‚Äòhopeless‚Äô? 

This simple app could help you on your journey to recovering your mental health. 
Everyday, for the next three months, it has a daily tip or task, which should inspire you to get your life back on track. These mental health suggestions are centred around positivity and well-being therapy, but taking a 'small steps' approach so that they are achievable. 

By having a go at a mental health task each day, the aim is that you take more time to appreciate life, which will help on the road to recovery.
Keep a record of your achievements by updating its journal as a reminder of your mental health journey.
This app is designed to support those struggling with such mental health conditions as negativity, stress, anxiety and depression. This is not about quick-fixes or false promises. This is about real progress, a day at a time.

Check out the trailer at: https://youtu.be/TngFFVhlQfw

This is great value and is the full product - there are No Ads or In-App-Purchases in this app.

By having a go at a mental health task each day, the aim is that you take more time to appreciate life, which will help on the road to recovery.
Keep a record of your achievements by updating its journal as a reminder of your mental health journey.
This app is designed to support those struggling with such mental health conditions as negativity, stress, anxiety and depression. This is not about quick-fixes or false promises. This is about real progress, a day at a time.

Check out the trailer at: https://youtu.be/TngFFVhlQfw

This is great value and is the full product - there are No Ads or In-App-Purchases in this app.
summary: Mental health daily therapy to help with stress, anxiety and depression

title: BrainwaveX Stress Pro
description:
BrainwaveX Stress is a groundbreaking brainwave therapy to reduce stress and recover the destructive effects of (chronic) stress in the brain and the body.

Stressful life events can harm your brain's memory and learning capacity by reducing the volume of gray matter in brain regions associated with emotions, self-control and physiological functions.
Exposed to chronic stress early in life are prone to mental problems such as anxiety and mood disorders later in life, as well as learning difficulties.
Ongoing stress can contribute to lost volume in the brain's medial prefrontal cortex and halt the production of new neurons in the hippocampus.

BainwaveX Stress consist of 2 different sessions. 
Both sessions are 3:30 minutes.

Free session is 2:30 minutes,


Get ready for a total natural healing.


http://www.brainwavex.com

title: Control Stress
description:
Here, we would like to start, by giving you an introduction to what stress is, what the signs of stress are, what simple steps you can take when feeling stressed and provide practical advice for preventing it, to show why we are passionate about moving towards a less stressed nation.
What is stress?
Stress is a feeling of being under abnormal pressure. This pressure can come from different aspects of your day to day life. Such as an increased workload, a transitional period, an argument you have with your family or new and existing financial worries. You may find that it has a cumulative effect, with each stressor building on top of one another.

During these situations you may feel threatened or upset and your body might create a stress response. This can cause a variety of physical symptoms, change the way you behave, and lead you to experience more intense emotions.


Stress affects us in a number of ways, both physically and emotionally and in varying intensities.
How can I identify the signs of stress?
Everyone experiences stress. However, when it is affecting your life, health and wellbeing, it is important to tackle it as soon as possible, and while stress affects everyone differently, there are common signs and symptoms you can look out for:15

feelings of constant worry or anxiety
feelings of being overwhelmed
difficulty concentrating
mood swings or changes in your mood
difficulty relaxing
depression
low self-esteem
eating more or less than usual
changes in your sleeping habits
aches and pains, particularly muscle tension
Three steps to take when feeling stressed
 

1. Realise when it is causing you a problem
Try to make the connection between feeling tired or ill and the pressures you are faced with
Look out for physical warnings such as tense muscles, over-tiredness, headaches or migraines38
2. Identify the causes
Try to identify the underlying causes
Sort the possible reasons for your stress into three categories 1) those with a practical solution 2) those that will get better given time and 3) those you can‚Äôt do anything about
Try to release the worry of those in the second and third groups and let them go
3. Review your lifestyle
Could you be taking on too much?
Are there things you are doing which could be handed over to someone else?
Can you do things in a more leisurely way?
To act on the answer to these questions, you may need to prioritise things you are trying to achieve and re-organise your life
This will help to release pressure that can come from trying to do everything at once
How can you help yourself?
Stress is a natural reaction to many situations in life, such as work, family, relationships and money problems.

We mentioned earlier on that a moderate amount of stress can help us perform better in challenging situations,34 but too much or prolonged stress can lead to physical problems. This can include lower immunity levels,35 digestive and intestinal difficulties, e.g. irritable bowel syndrome (IBS),36 or mental health problems such as depression.37 It is therefore important that we manage our stress and keep it at a healthy level to prevent long-term damage to our bodies and minds.

title: The Psychology of Stress
description:
Do you ever feel blue, strained, or anxious? Millions of people struggle with tension, anxiety, or mood issues. They may wear and tear on your body leaving you feeling fatigued, drained, and empty inside.

Let me explain...

Over time, tension and anxiety can build causing you to be less productive, uneasy, tense, and even unhappy. A poor mood may make you irritable, impatient, and hurt your relationships. You might find it tough to center, stay motivated, or achieve tasks.

And the worst part? The more you don't know the less you will succeed!

Make no mistake about it...
"The Costs of NOT Getting All The Info You Need Are Just Too High!"

Your lack of knowledge in this area may not be your fault, but that doesn‚Äôt mean that you shouldn‚Äôt -- or can‚Äôt -- do anything to find out everything you need to know to finally be a success! 

The costs of continuing to repeat this pattern are just too steep...

I mean, think about all of the money you‚Äôre wasting because of how continuing to try things that don't work costs you money... the time you‚Äôre losing due to going around in circles is also time-consuming... 

... and that‚Äôs not to mention the toll it‚Äôs taking on your personal life, like the way the failed attempts over and over can impact personal life/relationships.

So today -- in the next FEW MINUTES, in fact -- we‚Äôre going to help you GET ON TRACK, and learn how you can quickly and easily get your stress management under control... for GOOD!

That is why I've written this book... 

"This Book Below Will Show You Exactly What What You Need To Do To Finally Be A Success With Stress Management!"


As a person just like you who has struggled with these issues, I have searched high and low to find the best strategies to fix this problem and I am fully qualified and equipped to help you put an end to your frustration with trying to wade through all the info you need to know to be a success in stress management.

Your mood and mental well-being impacts every part of your life for better or worse. While poor feelings may negatively impact your activities, relationships, and work. A happy balanced mood gives you the tools you need to be successful and savor life.

Gaining and maintaining a positive mood may be tough. Till recently, there have been few options for those looking to boost their mood.

And all of this up till now is just the beginning!

Are you ready?

title: Stress Relief Hypnosis
descriptionHTML:
Relief and manage your stress with this powerful application by Shoonger Product.



What you are getting with the app:-
a) relief your stress with a hypnotherapy audio;
b) journal your experience worth remembering;
c) capture picture of beautiful moments;
d) a mindset to handle stress;
e) stress survival strategies.



In this modern era, stress is experienced at every level of human development from 5 years old kid all the way to an eighty years old adult. Stress can effect us negatively in many way from headache to body ache to blood pressure, sleeping and eating disorder, inability to stay focus, loosing temper easily, depression and our relationship with others deteriorates.

Stress is unavoidable. It is difficult to eliminate stress. However we would want to bring it down to a manageable level and subsequently to use it to our advantage. And this is exactly what this application does best. To reduce, prevent and enable you to cope with your stress at a manageable level.



Hypnotherapy is a traditional art used by professional hypnotist to help its client cure from various type of psychology problem. It is a perfect stress management technique and this is exactly what you are getting with this application.


This is a self-improvement hypnotherapy program that you can use on yourself to induce 'self-hypnosis' and bring you to a state of peace, tranquility and calmness. Hypnotherapy had become a popular choice for many people to improve many aspect of their life from overcoming phobia to breaking out of limiting beliefs and is also the perfect choice to manage your stress level.



'Self-hypnosis' hypnotherapy, is a safe and convenient method you will get from this app to bring yourself to the desired state. While in this 'self-hypnosis' state, you are still in control of yourself and have the choice to follow the suggested scenario or to reject. You never loose this choice even while under hypnosis.



Go ahead and use this program to manage your stress. And the best part of all its FREE.
summary: This is one app which can reduce your stress level to a manageable level.

title: iRelease Relieve Stress and Increase Energy Now
description:
Are you sick and tired of being run by your emotions?

With the iRelease app, available in six languages, you can choose to dissolve your stress and other negative emotions right on the spot, so you‚Äôre in charge of your emotions‚Äîinstead of your emotions being in charge of you!

Live the vibrant, successful life you‚Äôve always wanted by welcoming your natural ability to let go of those debilitating feelings of frustration, anxiety, depression, self-doubt, confusion and more‚Ä¶ And let relaxation, aliveness, creativity, ease and happiness be your everyday experience.

The simple, gentle process featured in this app is The Sedona Method¬Æ, the world-renowned process for letting go or ‚Äúreleasing‚Äù negative emotions developed by Lester Levenson in 1974, further enhanced by Hale Dwoskin, Sedona Training Associates, and used by hundreds of thousands of people around the world for over 46 years.

Achieve real and lasting results like these:
‚Ä¢ Enjoy higher self-esteem and self-confidence
‚Ä¢ Feel calm, centered and focused throughout your day
‚Ä¢ Stay positive and motivated towards your goals
‚Ä¢ Experience productive action with greater ease
‚Ä¢ Unwind naturally and get a good night‚Äôs sleep
‚Ä¢ Have greater peace of mind and an inner sense of well-being

Convenient, easy listening, perfect for rejuvenating breaks throughout your day, the guided audio tracks are 3 - 6 minutes in length in either male or female voice. This updated new version still has the App pages and audio tracks in English, including synched English subtitles, but with the additional feature of choosing complete, accurate translations of all pages and audio tracks with synched subtitles in the following languages:  ÿßŸÑÿπÿ±ÿ®Ÿäÿ© (Arabic), ‰∏≠Êñá (Chinese), Espa√±ol (Spanish), Fran√ßais (French), ‡§π‡§ø‡§®‡•ç‡§¶‡•Ä (Hindi). 

Tim McCavitt, co-founder of Sedona Releasing Worldwide, is a Sedona Method Licensed Instructor. He teaches Sedona Method seminars and coaches clients worldwide. The Sedona Method has been an integral part of his life since 1978; he worked with Lester Levenson for many years.

Annrika James, co-founder of Sedona Releasing Worldwide, is a Sedona Method Licensed Instructor. She has been practicing The Sedona Method since 1976 when she met Lester Levenson, working closely with him for 16 years as one of the first Sedona Method Instructors. She teaches seminars internationally with her husband, Tim, and coaches clients worldwide.

comments: Thank you Annrika and Tim for this awesome app ! I have been doing the Sedona Method for many years now. And I have been doing the releasing almost every morning and every night on my own and it's been life changing. This app though has been like a treat, to just be able to let someone else guide me through whatever is arising, right in that moment, even if I don't even know what it is ( like some weird sensation in my gut that is stuck there, or the resistance that was stopping me from doing some things that I had to get done. I could not seem to move it... releasing on my own) So I just started listening to your lovely voice and afterwards... I just started to do what I had to do. It was like magic...!!! This app is such a valuable gift that you have so generously given to us. Even those of us who have been doing the SM for years. Both of your voices sound so wonderful, so gentle, compassionate, nurturing, loving and there is a sense of being held in a confident, secure, solid state of spacious, unconditional Love and Acceptance. And I also like how you have set the app up technically.... how you can find what you want and do it with ease... And.. Lots of good info about the Method releasing and how to use it.... for the beginners and for everyone.,. Very well done !! Thank you... Thank you.... I highly recommend this app to anyone, whether you are unfamiliar with the Sedona Method and Releasing or an experienced SM releaser !! Josephine Lawless

Love this app. I've been getting a lot out of the releases. The only drawback is how the app keeps the screen on even when a recording has stopped and some time has passed. I mention this because the other night I fell asleep listening to a release--and because I hadn't plugged the charger in properly, I awoke to a nearly dead phone. Perhaps you could fix this on the next update? Otherwise, superb app. Thank you always, Annie and Tim! ‚ù§Ô∏è

This is by far one of the most useful apps I have on my phone. I use it daily. I learned the Sedona Method 25 years ago. Have been using it ever since. The app is a wonderful new add on...proving...there's always more good to come. Consider this app as a best friend or companion that will gently guide you back to yourself when you're feeling "off"...and remind you how wonderful you truly are.
Its perfectly succinct. Exactly what you need as a releaser to keep it simple, and go deeper.
This app is amazing. I love the releases. It's really useful to use every day and I love there are subtitles too.

title: HMM HAA - Breathe and Relax, Sleep, Remove Stress
description:
HMM HAA is a free android app with a collection of breathing exercises that will guide you to breathe better and thus live a happier life.

There are moments in life when you feel under the weather, tired to the bones, can't fall asleep, and just want to snap.

With HMM HAA, we will guide you with our visual and vibration aid through a list of breathing exercises that will help you remove distraction, raise energy, fall asleep, reduce stress, and heighten concentration for a better and happier life.


* How to use:
Step 1: Download the app
Step 2: Select breathing type and background image 
Step 3: Select play

That's it!

* List of our breathing exercises
1. Equal Breath to remove distraction
2. Stimulating Breath to raise vital energy and increase alertness
3. Relaxing Breath, also known as '4-7-8 Breathing technique' for falling asleep and relaxation
4. Tactical Breathing to reduce stress and stay calm
5. Box Breathing for enhanced performance and concentration


* Additional Features
- You can lock the screen so that the screen doesn't automatically turn off.
- Vibration aid to guide you with the breathing exercise without looking at the phone.


Download HMM HAA and start breathing better with our list of breathing exercises!

comments: Very effective paced breathing app--my favorite out of a dozen I tried. I love the simple breathing circle paired with optional vibration cues so I can opt to close eyes or look away and still keep pace. I like the different background choices, and selection of different breathing paces for different effects. I'd love to see the app developed to add music and/or tone options for relaxation, binaural beats, and auditory pace cues. But even without that, it's still my go-to breathing app. Update 7/18: Unfortunately the app, when installed on my new phone (Asus ZenPhone Z01FD), will no longer load any background images, even after trying to uninstall and reinstall). When clicking "background," I only get a black screen with no options. I'm hopeful for an update to fix this.
Like it only improvement I would make is a sound like bell,wind,or something calm

title: Withings Health Mate
description:
Whether you‚Äôre looking to lose weight, get more active, monitor blood pressure, or even sleep better, Health Mate unleashes the power of Withings health devices, backed by a decade of expertise. In the app you‚Äôll find health data that is easy to understand, personalized, and fully leverageable by you and your doctor. 

With Health Mate, be empowered to take action‚Äîand start mastering your vitals.

TRACK YOUR VITALS

WEIGHT & BODY COMPOSITION MONITORING
Reach your weight goals with advanced insights including weight, weight trends, BMI & body composition.

ACTIVITY & SPORT MONITORING
Automatically track your daily activity and workout sessions with in-depth insights including steps, heart rate, multisport tracking, connected GPS & Fitness Level assessment. 

SLEEP ANALYSIS / BREATHING DISTURBANCES DETECTION
Improve your nights with sleep-lab worthy results (sleep cycles, sleep score, heart rate, snoring & more) and uncover breathing disturbances.

HYPERTENSION MANAGEMENT
Monitor hypertension from the comfort of your home with medically-accurate systolic and diastolic blood pressure results, plus reports you can share with your doctor to monitor the efficacy of treatment.


...WITH A SIMPLE & SMART APP

EASY TO USE
Only one app for all Withings products for a holistic view of your health, in the palm of your hands. 

EASY TO UNDERSTAND
All the results are displayed clearly with normality ranges & color-coded feedback to know exactly where you stand. 

TAILORED HEALTH INSIGHTS
Knowing your data is good, but knowing how to interpret it is better. Health Mate has now a voice and will highlight particularly relevant data for your health and enrich your experience with a science-based interpretation of this data.

SHAREABLE REPORTS FOR YOUR DOCTORS
Easily share data with healthcare professionals including blood pressure, weight trends, temperatures & more. Get also access to a full health report that can be shared to your practician via PDF.

THE COMPANION TO Google Fit & YOUR FAVORITE APPS
Health Mate and Google Fit work seamlessly together, so you can retrieve all your health data in one place for easier health tracking.  Health Mate is also compatible with 100+ top health & fitness apps including Strava, MyFitnessPal and Runkeeper.


ABOUT WITHINGS

WITHINGS creates devices embedded in easy-to-use everyday objects that connect to a unique app and act as powerful daily health check-ups, as well as tools to help master long-term health goals. Our team of engineers, doctors, and health professionals invents the world‚Äôs most efficient devices to help track and analyze anyone‚Äôs vitals, via a decade of expertise.

comments: Installed this app on my Android phone then paired successfully with my new ScanWatch without problems. Then the app completely stopped working. Now all I get is the error message that it's not responding. Reinstalled the app twice no difference. Had to install it on my Android tablet (not ideal) but at least it now works. Great watch but not a very proficient app.

Doesn't sync with samsung galaxy watch for steps or heart rate. Cannot manually enter steps either. Primarily syncs with withings gear. So I only use it to track my weight with my withings scale. Also the scale is strange in that it can't do math. For example if you weigh 190 on Monday and 189.5 on Tuesday it will say you lost .4 pounds.

Can't connect Steel HR. Reinstalled the app, factory reset the watch but nothing. It searches for the watch but doesn't find it. Bluetooth is on, watch is active. It just doesn't connect. Edit: connected the watch to an iPhone which worked fine. Reset everything and tried again on my android (moto g6) and it worked. The watch is great, the app is fine. Wish it had more features and flexibility but it's fine.

Update: I made a new account Withings account with an Outlook email address. Changing from 1* to 2* since I can now at least try out the device. Original: Unable to login. I enter my gmail and password, hit login, and it progresses to a page asking for name, gender, etc. However I can't enter my name or gender because a new pop up shows asking if I want to login with Google or email. Can't back out of pop up. Trying to progress with Google or email again leads to app crashing.

Relevant information provided however inaccurate on linked apps like Samsung Health it does not transfer and record the data from the linked app efficiently or effectively. Misses between 200 to 300 steps, confuses workouts recorded and causes some workouts to be overriden in recording if you add your own workout. Needs some bugs like that fixed so it transfers and records accurate data from linked apps. Othereise I use it daily and like to see progression and results. Thanks.

title: HOLD - Stress Help & Self-Care
description:
HOLD is your personal space to let out what is on your mind and make self-reflection more effective.
Avoid everyday anxiety and stress by taking control of your thoughts when it‚Äôs right for you instead of overthinking at times you don‚Äôt want to, like before going to sleep. Make this space your own by filling it with thoughts, ideas, worries, concerns, feelings, hopes and dreams. Use it knowing that anything you don‚Äôt want to keep inside your mind - HOLD will hold it for you.

Often people cannot engage properly with things that are on their mind because it might be hard or confusing, it may take the time they don‚Äôt have or it may seem like a waste of time. Talking with yourself in HOLD helps you release your thoughts in a clear and productive way and without fear of judgment. You can always return to these conversations later with a fresh perspective so you can continue to progress even if you have little time in your life. 

HOLD guides you into learning self-reflection in an easy and accessible way, encouraging you to develop your personal practice of self-reflection and maintain useful and healthy thought processes. Get to the core of what is on your mind and discover your own patterns. 


WHAT YOU CAN DO WITHHOLD: 

- Have a conversation with yourself, to help you explore your thoughts
- Let out what‚Äôs on your mind by speaking or writing
- Everything is stored so you don‚Äôt forget anything unless you delete it
- Log your mood for each conversation with yourself and keep track of how it changes
- Read and listen back to your thoughts to reflect more clearly
- Use the Tools to deepen your self-reflections 
- Create collections of conversations to better understand your own patterns
- Gradually learn self-reflection techniques 
- Set up reminders and build your own self-reflection routine 

KEY BENEFITS: 

- Clear your mind
- Think more clearly and listen to yourself
- Talk about things without worrying about what you are sharing and with who
- Reduce stress and anxiety 
- Don‚Äôt forget things that are important to you - hold yourself to account
- Learn how to self-reflect with structure 
- Potentially Improve your mental wellbeing and overall happiness
- Feel more in control of your life


WHY SELF-REFLECTION?

Self-reflection is a unique function of the human mind that occurs naturally; it allows you to consider and respond to what you think, feel and do. 

HOLD has been developed by combining classical psychological theories and contemporary self-reflection research with today‚Äôs cutting-edge technologies. It allows you to create your own self-reflection space that grows with you.

HOLD helps you have semi-structured conversations with yourself and equips you with tools and techniques which can positively expand your thinking, instead of feeling limited by stress and anxiety.

As you master the stages in HOLD you will develop your self-reflection practice, stimulating deeper thinking and a greater understanding of yourself, helping you to feel empowered and in control of who you are and what you are doing in life.

With HOLD you can take time to talk, reflect and learn about yourself. We value your privacy, so we ensure that all the information you enter in the app will only be stored on your phone and never shared with anyone.


Take hold of your thoughts and improve your mental wellbeing. Reduce anxiety and stress by taking control of what is on your mind. 

Download HOLD now for free, no sign-up required.

title: Branches Stress Relief
description:
Feeling stressed or anxious? Branches is a free app offering many features intended to relieve stress and other strong emotions. Start out using the app by inputting your current emotion and physical feelings, and Branches will generate three activity suggestions to help you boost your mood. The app also contains a guided breathing animation, numerous mindfulness meditation audios, and extensive informational resources. Best of all, the app is completely free to use, unlike many of its popular competitors. Never worry about advertisements or in-app purchases with Branches, as all features are 100% free to use.

Branches was created as a high school project during a mentorship with a health psychologist. It is not intended to be a substitution for therapy, but rather a resource to help people, especially teenagers, deal with typical levels of stress and anxiety. All information not cited in the app was told to me by my mentor, Dr. Michelle Di Paolo.

title: Avoiding Stress
description:
Stress is common experience for most people. In fact, 70% of adults say they feel stress or  daily.

Here are some simple ways to relieve stress and anxiety.
Exercise
Exercise is one of the most important things you can do to combat stress.

It might seem contradictory, but putting physical stress on your body through exercise can relieve mental stress.

The benefits are strongest when you exercise regularly. People who exercise regularly are less likely to experience anxiety than those who don‚Äôt exercise (1).

There are a few reasons behind this:

Stress hormones: Exercise lowers your body‚Äôs stress hormones ‚Äî such as cortisol ‚Äî in the long run. It also helps release endorphins, which are chemicals that improve your mood and act as natural painkillers.
Sleep: Exercise can also improve your sleep quality, which can be negatively affected by stress and anxiety.
Confidence: When you exercise regularly, you may feel more competent and confident in your body, which in turn promotes mental wellbeing.
Try to find an exercise routine or activity you enjoy, such as walking, dancing, rock climbing or yoga.
Activities ‚Äî such as walking or jogging ‚Äî that involve repetitive movements of large muscle groups can be particularly stress relieving.
Consider supplements
Several supplements promote stress and anxiety reduction. Here is a brief overview of some of the most common ones:

Lemon balm: Lemon balm is a member of the mint family that has been studied for its anti-anxiety effects (2).
Omega-3 fatty acids: One study showed that medical students who received omega-3 supplements experienced a 20% reduction in anxiety symptoms (3).
Ashwagandha: Ashwagandha is an herb used in Ayurvedic medicine to treat stress and anxiety. Several studies suggest that it‚Äôs effective (4).
Green tea: Green tea contains many polyphenol antioxidants which provide health benefits. It may lower stress and anxiety by increasing serotonin levels (5).
Valerian: Valerian root is a popular sleep aid due to its tranquilizing effect. It contains valerenic acid, which alters gamma-aminobutyric acid (GABA) receptors to lower anxiety.
Kava kava: Kava kava is a psychoactive member of the pepper family. Long used as a sedative in the South Pacific, it is increasingly used in Europe and the US to treat mild stress and anxiety (6).
Some supplements can interact with medications or have side effects, so you may want to consult with a doctor if you have a medical condition.
Shop for ashwagandha, omega-3 supplements, green tea, and lemon balm online.
Light a candle
Using essential oils or burning a scented candle may help reduce your feelings of stress and anxiety.

Some scents are especially soothing. Here are some of the most calming scents:

Lavender
Rose
Vetiver
Bergamot
Roman chamomile
Neroli
Frankincense
Sandalwood
Ylang ylang
Orange or orange blossom
Geranium
Reduce your caffeine intake
Caffeine is a stimulant found in coffee, tea, chocolate and energy drinks. High doses can increase anxiety (10).

People have different thresholds for how much caffeine they can tolerate.

If you notice that caffeine makes you jittery or anxious, consider cutting back.

Although many studies show that coffee can be healthy in moderation, it‚Äôs not for everyone. In general, five or fewer cups per day is considered a moderate amount.
Take a yoga class
Yoga has become a popular method of stress relief and exercise among all age groups.

While yoga styles differ, most share a common goal ‚Äî to join your body and mind.

Yoga primarily does this by increasing body and breath awareness.

Some studies have examined yoga‚Äôs effect on mental health. Overall, research has found that yoga can enhance mood and may even be as effective as antidepressant drugs at treating depression and anxiety (17).

However, many of these studies are limited, and there are still questions about how yoga works to achieve stress reduction.
